identity.name: GridWise
identity.description: A dark-mode, high-contrast energy management dashboard designed to impress technical interviewers. It prioritizes data density, legibility, and real-time feedback over decorative fluff.

mono.usage: Data Values, Timestamps, Code Snippets, Chart Axes

rules: Use Chivo Black (900) for main page titles (text-4xl+).
Use JetBrains Mono for ALL numerical data and chart tooltips.
Keep line-height tight (leading-none) for large numbers.

cards.style: Flat surface with 1px border. No drop shadows in dark mode.

charts.style: Minimalist. Hide grid lines or make them very subtle (opacity 0.1). Custom tooltips are mandatory.

buttons.primary: bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white rounded-lg px-4 py-2 font-medium transition-all

inputs.style: bg-zinc-950 border border-zinc-800 focus:border-blue-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-blue-500 rounded-md

visual_enhancers.glows: Use sparingly on active states or 'live' indicators.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SCAFFOLD: Create a new React + Vite + Tailwind project. Do not use the existing 'horizon-ui-chakra' folder. Start fresh in '/app/frontend_new' or similar.
2. INSTALL: shadcn/ui, recharts, lucide-react, framer-motion, clsx, tailwind-merge.
3. THEME: Force Dark Mode. Add 'dark' class to html/body or configure tailwind to use dark mode by default.
4. LAYOUT: Implement the Sidebar Layout with a 'DashboardLayout' component.
5. DATA: Mock the energy data (wind, solar, consumption) with realistic time-series arrays.
6. AI INSIGHTS: Create a panel that simulates AI analysis (e.g., 'Efficiency up 12% due to optimal wind conditions').
7. REAL-TIME: Use `setInterval` to update a 'Live Power' number every 2 seconds to simulate WebSocket.
8. TESTING: Add `data-testid` to all interactive elements.
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI Slop': No generic gradients, no centered text layouts.
Density: This is a dashboard. Use the screen real estate. Don't leave massive empty gaps.
Contrast: Ensure text is readable against the dark background. Use Zinc-400 for labels, White for values.
Motion: Add subtle layout transitions using framer-motion (layout prop).
